messages.content: Hi Kai, I'm Morgan. Just got you set up on my machine. I'm a senior backend engineer at Stripe, been there about two years now.
Hey Morgan, nice to meet you. Happy to help however I can. Stripe — that's a great place to be. What kind of work do you focus on there?
I'm on the payments infrastructure team. Mostly working in Go, some Python for tooling and data pipelines. We run everything on AWS.
Got it — Go for the core infra, Python for tooling, AWS underneath. Makes sense for payments scale.
Yeah exactly. Oh and I use Neovim as my main editor, tmux for everything. I know it's old school but I can't go back.
Nothing wrong with that — plenty of people swear by that setup for good reason.
I'm on an M2 MacBook Pro for work and I have an Arch Linux desktop at home that I use for personal projects and gaming.
Nice combo. I'll keep both environments in mind when suggesting anything.
Hey, random question. I'm trying to get better about mornings. Right now I wake up around 7:30 and just immediately check Slack, which I hate.
Yeah that's a common trap. What would an ideal morning look like for you?
I'd love to run first thing. I used to run 5Ks pretty regularly, haven't in months. And then maybe read for 20 minutes before work.
That's doable. Would you want me to help you build a schedule around that? Like a 6:15 alarm, run by 6:30, back and showered by 7:15, reading until 7:45?
That sounds great actually. My partner Jamie gets up at 6 anyway so I wouldn't be waking anyone.
Perfect. I'll note that down. Do you run outdoors or treadmill?
Outdoors when the weather's okay. We live in Portland so rain is frequent, but I don't mind running in light rain. If it's really pouring I'll do a bodyweight workout at home instead.
Makes sense. Portland rain is more drizzle than storm most of the time anyway.
Exactly. Oh and I should mention, I have a slight knee issue on my left side. My PT said I should avoid steep downhill running and do quad strengthening exercises twice a week.
Good to know. I'll keep that in mind if I ever suggest routes or workouts.
